stream_context.summary: Kaze, while feeling ill, builds "Part 2" of the overworld—the cliff-side connector between the already-outlined Parts 1 and 3—and iterates on how the player will reach later areas after Bowser 1.

development_findings.summary: Parts 1 and 3 of the overworld are outlined; Part 2 (the connector between them) is now blocked-in, marking the overworld at roughly 60 % complete.
development_findings.quote: I think we can start working on part 2 then, since part 1 and part 3's outline is done.

development_findings.summary: Original plan to gate progress with a Yoshi who repairs a bridge for 100 coins was scrapped; new idea is a chained Dory in a lake who becomes rideable after Yoshis are freed, providing passage to Part 5.
development_findings.quote: Dory chained to a wall in the lake… After beating the first Bowser, the Yoshi is on Dory's back. … You can ride [her].

development_findings.summary: Kaze’s custom engine no longer uses invisible walls; collision was rewritten so level boundaries feel natural.
development_findings.quote: My engine actually doesn't have invisible walls anymore. … I reworked how Mario handles collision altogether.

development_findings.summary: Platforming above deep pits should feel dramatic but not punishing; Kaze is searching for non-water solutions so falling isn’t deadly yet stays believable in the island’s interior.
development_findings.quote: I want the feeling of like this but without the platforming difficulty of this. I don't want the player to fall down here.

development_findings.summary: 15 main courses are finished; remaining scope is overworld build-out and a handful of side levels—"the final stretch."
development_findings.quote: We have 15 courses done and now we're doing the overworld and then a couple more side levels.

development_findings.summary: To set the precedent that coins matter in the overworld, Course 3’s entrance will cost the player 100 coins, paid to tired Monty Moles in a mineshaft.
development_findings.quote: The boss doesn't pay us enough for this. But for 100 coins, I wouldn't mind speeding up a bit over here.

development_findings.summary: Kaze intends to create code that pans through every area highlighting invisible-wall triangles, turning it into a long, sponsor-friendly video.
development_findings.quote: That's gonna be the freest video ever… just the code that shows every collision triangle in the game.

development_findings.summary: If a PC version happens, it will piggy-back on Wiseguy’s static recompilation port rather than rewriting RTYI for PC from scratch.
development_findings.quote: It would be a lot easier to port the PC port to RTYI than RTYI to the PC port.

development_findings.summary: Kaze keeps placeholder textures (trees, rocks) during layout passes, planning visual polish later.
development_findings.quote: All of these are placeholder. It's not supposed to look pretty.

development_findings.summary: He is open to swapping all Nintendo assets for original ones if a takedown occurs, allowing commercial release.
development_findings.quote: I'm half hoping Nintendo shuts me down so I have to exchange all the assets for non-Nintendo assets so I can actually sell it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is severely ill (vomiting, headache) but streams anyway at reduced pace; attributes illness to Zeina and jokes about "cooties."
context_findings.quote: I vomited like six times before it was 10 a.m. … I got cooties from Zeina.

context_findings.summary: He accepted a lucrative Squarespace sponsorship (6 videos in 3 months) and plans to repurpose actor rework content to meet the quota.
context_findings.quote: I recently took a sponsor deal with Squarespace… I'm just going to make a video about each actor rework.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: avoid fake barriers, allow player ‘cheese’, and keep camera control; dislikes Tetris’ hold feature and 2D games without analog sticks.
context_findings.quote: If you find a way around it, be my guest. I don't want to put fake barriers there.

context_findings.summary: Believes Nintendo’s legal actions are unpredictable; plans to delay release to reduce takedown risk and runs Patreon despite previous legal attention.
context_findings.quote: Even after it is complete, I will still need to… find a good moment in time to actually release it, because I don't want Nintendo to instantly kill me.

context_findings.summary: Personal reading interests (Thinking, Fast and Slow) inform his views on leveraging human psychology in game design.
context_findings.quote: This is where I chill my favorite book, Thinking Fast and Slow, which has some very good insights into how to design games and abuse human biases.

biobak.summary: Gave Kaze the idea to visualize every invisible wall for a sponsor video, which Kaze immediately adopted.
biobak.quote: Oh my god, Biobak, that's such a good idea. I will just do that.

biobak.summary: Provided Blender shortcut (Ctrl-E) tip and general chat feedback during level block-out.

zeina.summary: Made soup and tea for sick Kaze and participated in brainstorming how Yoshi rescue should unlock new areas.

key_stories.title: Bridge Dilemma Becomes Dory Passage
key_stories.summary: Kaze hated the notion of paying a Yoshi to repair a bridge after saving them. During the stream he brainstormed alternatives and settled on chaining Dory in a lake; freeing Yoshis prompts them to release Dory, giving Mario a ride to the next overworld part.
key_stories.challenge: Gate progression after Bowser 1 felt thematically wrong and mechanically clunky.
key_stories.process: Rejected coin-for-bridge idea, evaluated rafts and flutter jumps, finally drafted chained-Dory concept and documented it.
key_stories.outcome: New gating mechanic defined and added to design notes for implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: Dory chained to a wall in the lake… You can ride this Dory after the Yoshis free her.

key_stories.title: Sponsor Video Shortcut
key_stories.summary: Facing six Squarespace videos in three months, Kaze needed quick topics. Biobak suggested auto-visualizing Mario 64’s invisible walls; Kaze recognized it as ‘the freest video ever’ and committed to coding it.
key_stories.challenge: Produce six sponsored videos without derailing development time.
key_stories.process: Accepted Biobak’s idea, planned code to pan across every level highlighting collision triangles.
key_stories.outcome: Video concept locked; will fulfill sponsorship while promoting RTYI.
key_stories.key_quote: That's gonna save me so much time—I'll program this later and then make the video.
